summary: Frontend implements a two-step groomer→services scheduler flow with React Query loading/error/retry states and a non-blue/purple theme. Backend exposes query APIs for groomers and services, but appears to lack required seed/sample data and stable identifiers for services (and groomer IDs may not be stable/unique).

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend can be initialized with seed/sample groomers and services so the UI is usable immediately after deployment.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend initializes `groomers` as an empty Map and provides only mutation methods to add data later; no seed/sample data initialization is shown.
evidence: backend/main.mo (let groomers = Map.empty<Nat, Groomer>(); no prepopulation/initialization code)

missing_requirements.requirement: Returned data includes stable identifiers and display names for groomers and services.
missing_requirements.reason: Services have no identifier field at all (only title/description/priceRange), and groomer IDs are derived from `name.size()` which is not guaranteed stable/unique across groomers with same-length names.
evidence: backend/main.mo (type Service = { title; description; priceRange; } — no id)

hallucinated_features.description: Backend mutation APIs to add groomers and add services to groomers (write methods).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asked for query methods to list groomers and list services for a groomer; write/admin functionality was not requested.
